question: Level 15 Monk, Level 3 Warlock, Level 2 Paladin: Can you cast Armor of Agathys at level 1?
answer: Yes. You have three 1st-level spell slots and three 5th-level spell slots.
rules_explanation: As a multiclassed character, you have spell slots based on your combined levels in spellcasting classes, and you have prepared or learned spells based on your individual class levels. Therefore, you will have access to level 1 spell slots from the combined spellcasting levels, but learn spells individually from each class.

question: The ability of a level 15 barbarian. Is inspiration a fancy Barbarian thing?
answer: No. The Barbarian class description does not mention Inspiration.
rules_explanation: Only class features explicitly described in the class details are available to members of that class

question: Can level 15 Rogue/Level 3 Warlock/Level 2 Paladin use their action and movement to dash 90 feet?
answer: If the character uses the Dash action it can move a distance up to double their speed (after applying modifiers).
rules_explanation: Characters can use actions to dash to gain extra movement for the turn equal to the character's speed. No specific rules prevent characters from travelling this amount, unless they are somehow unable to dash or move.

question: Can a level 15 Rogue/Level 3 Warlock/Level 2 Paladin use their action to fire a ranged attack with Boltblaster and bonus action hide, and gain advantage due to being hidden and sneak attack? How does Guiding Bolt Effect the sneak attack roll?
answer: A creature can hide as a bonus action, however doing so involves forfeiting its ability to then fire the weapon. Due to Guiding Bolt's effect, the next attack against the target will have advantage allowing sneak attack to be applied.
rules_explanation: Guiding bolt's text states that the next attack roll against the target has advantage. This lasts for a round. If you are hidden, you do get sneak attack.

question: If a Paladin/Cleric is on fire, what damage does it take each turn? Does Evasion help them?
answer: The amount of fire damage taken each turn is determined by the effect that set the character on fire. The evasion ability only reduces the damage from Dexterity saving throws and doesn't apply to ongoing fire damage.
rules_explanation: Evasion only helps with Dexterity saving throws, and the fire effect is typically a flat damage per turn.

question: If a 5th Level PC dies and Caduceus wants to use Gentle Repose, what are the effects?
answer: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration of up to 10 days, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead.
rules_explanation: As the spell states.

question: Given Allura's Staff is out of charges, if I roll a five, will the staff lose all of its great powers?
answer: No, nothing happens on a roll of five. If it rolls a one, it does lose the powers.
rules_explanation: According to the scenario.

question: Can a 6th level sorcerer with draconic bloodline use Control Flames cantrip to put out the flames all over their body?
answer: Yes, they can. Control Flames puts out flames.
rules_explanation: Cantrip that puts out fire, cast on body which has fire.

question: If I've run a whole round can I cast message then?
answer: Yes, if you have not already used your action.

question: can I use Control Flames to put out the flames all over my body?
answer: Control Flames: You choose a point within range and affect fire in a 15-foot cube. You can expand the flames, extinguish them, or change their color.
rules_explanation: The spell has no restrictions on what or who can be targeted, so you can use it to affect flames on your body

question: If a creature has resistance to fire, how is fire damage applied if there is also an effect that reduces all damage by 5?
answer: The 25 damage is first reduced by 5 and then halved, so the creature takes 10 damage.
rules: Combat > Damage and Healing > Damage Resistance and Vulnerability
rules_explanation: Resistance and then vulnerability are applied after all other modifiers to damage.

question: If a DM rolls a natural 20 for an NPC to save against Modify Memory, is it successful? Does advantage matter?
answer: If the creature is fighting the caster, it has advantage on the saving throw, then succeeds on the saving throw automatically with the natural 20.
rules_explanation: A roll of 20 on a saving throw is always a success.

question: Level 17 Monk, Level 3 Warlock, Level 2 Paladin is trying to do strength check for an athletics to leap across lava, can she cast guidance and/or blessing of the trickster?
answer: You can cast Guidance as an action. The Blessing of the Trickster spell is not described in the SRD.
rules_explanation: Blessing of the Trickster was not found in the SRD, however, you get one action to make the roll or cast guidance.

question: Can I help give advantage to an investigation check and be in the middle of a perception check at the same time?
answer: No, you can only concentrate on one action at a time.
rules: Using Ability Scores > Ability Checks > Working Together
rules_explanation: Only one character can make the ability check.

question: If a monster dies and becomes 3 smaller elementals, does Jester get advantage on any of them?
answer: Yes. The next attack against each of them has advantage.
rules_explanation: Guiding Bolt makes the next attack have advantage.

question: As a healer do I roll for level one spell again because it is more damage to a group of enemies that are weak?

question: What can I do when you're restrained?

question: Can the hilt of my sword be mistaken for a gun?

question: Can I use Allura's Staff to cast Cone of Cold, and is the DC going to be the staff or different than me?
answer: The attack bonus equals your spellcasting ability modifier + your proficiency bonus. The saving throw DC for a spell equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your spellcasting ability modifier.
rules_explanation: As specified in the SRD, the DC would be based on your stats and proficiency bonus.

question: If an entity is immune to fire damage, does that mean there is no extra damage on top?
answer: Because the Cataclysm Bolt is dealing extra damage on top, this is applied as normal before the target's immunity.
rules: Combat > Damage and Healing > Damage Resistance and Vulnerability
rules_explanation: Resistance and then vulnerability are applied after all other modifiers to damage.

question: Can you still attack when you're restrained?
answer: Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage, and the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws

question: Can I Sneak Attack more than once per turn?
answer: You can Sneak Attack only once per turn.
rules_explanation: The Rogue class details for the sneak attack ability specify it can only be done once per turn.

question: Does Stormrider Boots cause damage as I pass them?

question: What's the number of skill proficiencies does a level 15 Half-Elf Rogue/Warlock have?
answer: That character has a total of 4 + 2 + 0 = 6 skill proficiencies.
rules: Races > Half-Elf > Racial Traits > Skill Versatility
rules_explanation: The SRD states that Half-Elves get 2 skills, rogues can choose three skills and Warlocks can choose two skills at level 1. Since you can't get a skill proficiency twice from different classes or backgrounds, the total number of skills is 4 + 2 + 0 = 6.

question: I'm going to Guide myself. I'm going to Guide-- oh, wait. Can I Blessing of the Trickster-- you don't need it, you've got advantage anyway. Stealth Check Question:

question: what happens if it's the guardian of the sanctum releases an inferno that is a 50 foot radius, catching marion and they got some cover to--

question: When Marion has rolled a natural 20 and is naturally half resistant and is behind the side there. Can you clarify about her taking half of that total?
answer: When a effect is described of having damage cut by one half and another effect causes the same damage to be halved, the combined effect is not a three-quarters reduction. It is simply one half reduction. Resulting in one half the total.
rules: Combat > Damage and Healing > Damage Resistance and Vulnerability
rules_explanation: When the rules are applied, the natural 20 and resistance both do the same. Therefore, there isn't any additional effects.

question: Can anyone who is Restrained still attack?

question: After 6 to 8 hours of resting, how many hit dice have I gotten back?
answer: At the end of a long rest, a character regains all lost hit points. The character also regains spent Hit Dice, up to a number of dice equal to half of the character's total number of them (minimum of one die).
rules_explanation: Long rests determine hit die replenishment.
